Update: my friend found out that there's a way to optimize the fps in game BY A LOT! And here's how, they just tweak the files in unreal engine file(or something, I don't really know much) to remove or reduce the visual quality ingame to increase performance like removing/reducing grass and fog. Surely, this might help us mid&low end players but we're concerned as it technically(probably) violates the ToS. I'd appreciate a reply from the devs, also I'm giving back the 5star when I receive it.TY

Wuthering Waves enters the genre not as a contender, but as a hollow derivative. Its core is a tedious labyrinth of mechanics designed to exploit player engagement rather than reward it. While the 2.0 update applies a thin veneer of improvement, it fails to fix a fundamentally broken engine. The game's design feels transparently extractive‚Äîa textbook "pump and dump" clone rushed to market and further marred by a clumsy reliance on amateurish AI. Save your time; this journey, not worth taking.

Im using the iQOO Z9 5G with the Dimensity 7200 chipset, and I can run Genshin Impact smoothly on the highest settings without any lag or frame drops. But Wuthering Waves struggles even in smooth or low settings. The graphics, combat system, and world design are amazing-no doubt about that. But the performance is really disappointing, especially for mid-range devices like mine that are capable of handling heavy games. The game frequently stutters, lags during combat please solve this on Next up

ANYONE CAN LOSE PATIENCE after tuning 40+ echoes only to get mostly DEF or HP substats. I really like the game‚Äîespecially the rewards and combat system‚Äîwhich is what keeps me playing. However, this part of the game mechanic is what I hate the most. There‚Äôs no guarantee, even after tuning 100+ echoes, which are already hard and time-consuming to farm, especially when aiming for specific substats. On top of that, collecting echo EXP also takes a significant amount of time.

Let's be honest in a lot of ways, this game is just genshin. BUT imo this is far better than genshin. The combat is far superior, the exploration and puzzles are far more interesting. The farming doesn't feel as tedious, and the company seems to ACTUALLY care which is great. They don't just want your money. Hopefully, they continue to be a great company and hopefully, the voice acting will be improved, and some of the more grindy bits are made more lenient and they add more co-op stuff!

For those unaware, Wuthering Waves is not Kuro Games first mobile game. They launched Punishing Gray Raven globily a few years early, and like WuWa had a very rough start. But they continued supporting the game and, since then, has been one of the best mobile action games I have ever played. Wuthering Waves had its rough start, but I believe in Kuro games because of the accomplishments with their previous game. The character designs, the world, story and combat will only get better from here.

Addictive & Immersive! Wuthering Waves is an incredible game that's got me hooked! The unique blend of exploration, strategy, and relaxation is absolute perfection. Stunning visuals, captivating soundtrack, and intuitive controls make for an unforgettable experience. I love discovering hidden secrets and upgrading my gear. A true masterpiece!

Great open world mobility and skills makes exploration a lot of fun, like running on walls, grappling and ledge grab. The characters are very expressive and the designs are great. Love the graphics, not to mention the music in this game is phenomenal. Echo's, aka artifacts in other games, can be farmed in open world instead of just domains which makes coop really fun to play with. You can farm boss artifacts with friends without expanding any resources, made upgrading characters really fun.

Why leave a negative review for this epic game? In my opinion, you need a good phone to run it properly since it's developed in Unreal Engine and designed for PC and consoles. Wuthering Waves offers stunning graphics, smooth combat mechanics, an immersive open world, and a compelling storyline. You're playing a high-end game on mobile, so instead of complaining, consider upgrading your device to fully enjoy the experience.

Probably the best game of its genre. The combat is fluid, reasonably varied, and overall fun. The story is decent, and you can skip parts that don't interest you. Character design was initially weak but is now up there with Hoyo games. If this game had the courage to unsaddle itself from some of the toxic vestiges of its genre (stamina system, time-gated events), it would be a near-perfect game. Unfortunately, they don't trust players enough to let them off the daily grind leash.

The gameplay is so good, (like, parry, dodge, animation cancel) but I'd prefer if they add more male characters and improve on the character design, it feels a bit empty, but overall, it's fun. so many things to do in there. Excited to see what's more to come in the future update.

Wuthering Waves is an open-world action RPG with fast-paced combat, fluid traversal, and deep customization. The combat system features dodge/parry mechanics, elemental skills, and the unique Echo System, which lets players equip enemy abilities. Exploration is highly dynamic, allowing players to climb, glide, and grapple across a vast, vertical world. With responsive controls and engaging battles, the game stands out from other gacha RPGs.

Wuthering Waves is an exciting open-world RPG with a deep story, smooth combat, and fun traversal mechanics. The game offers dynamic movement, including sprinting, wall-running, and a grappling hook, making exploration enjoyable. The combat system is fast-paced and skill-based, with unique character abilities and combo-based attacks. Despite this, Wuthering Waves has great potential. If the developers improve optimization, it could become one of the best action RPGs.

20... GB. A 20gb mobile game. I am going to try this one out because Google is paying me to, but there is absolutely no reason any mobile game should be this big. Absolutely no data compression, and zero attempts made to streamline the coding. This is, so far, the pinnacle example of this sort of laziness overwhelming the game design world. The entirety of the PC versions of both Everquest and Perfect World could fit in less size, and both were of a scale that this could never hope to achieve.
